short_summary: The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is seeking a Courseware Developer (Level 2) to collaborate on the development and delivery of Microsoft Project Online training.

full_summary:
Title/Titre
------------

TBIPS X 1 - B.9 - Courseware Developer (Level 2)
SPICT X 1 - B.9 - Développeur de didacticiel (Niveau 2)

Tender Information
-----------------

### Reference Number
PW-23-01029769

### Solicitation Number
182486-TBIPS-RFP-CIHR-2023

### Publication Date (Appel offres publié)
March 10, 2023

### Tender Closing Date (Appel offres cloturé)
April 3, 2023 (14:00:00 EST)

### Amendments
The solicitation has been amended on February 24, 2023. A revised version of the Request for Proposal is provided in the attachment.

### Expected Contract Dates
This project is not expected to commence on a specific date. The expected contract period will be defined in the contract award.

Description of Requirement (Description de la prestation)
---------------------------------------------------

The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) requires the services of a Courseware Developer to collaborate on the development and delivery of online training. The primary objective is to develop and deliver the training with the end-user in mind to ensure a seamless and successful learning experience.

Skills and Abilities
-------------------

* Strong knowledge of online learning platforms and tools (LCMS, LMS, etc.)
* Excellent analysis and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Proficiency in Adobe Captivate, Articulate Storyline, or other similar e-learning development tools

Please note that the requirement is to collaborate with the development team. As a result, we encourage candidates with experience in similar roles and a willingness to learn and adapt to our processes and system to apply.

Below are some insightful steps you should follow if you are the contracting entity:

1. Check the detailed tender documents provided on the [Procurement Data Management System (PDMS) website](https://data-buy.canada.ca) to understand more about the bid results.
2. Submit your bid using the Electronic Bidding System (EBS) on the Government of Canada's buyandsell.gc.ca platform or through the Procurement Data Management System (PDMS).
3. Follow the submitted bid requirements and format.
4. Keep track of your requriments in the tender document that you received, to ensure that you have considered all necessary requirements and procedures.
